a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Sex ratio at birth by birth order, South Korea, 1970 to 2017
Sex ratio at birth measures the number of male births per 100 female births. This is shown below by birth order of
children i.e. the first, second or third-born child. Birth ratios are naturally male-biased, with an expected ratio of 105
Data source: Jiang et al. (2017). Changes in sex ratio at birth in china: a decomposition by birth order.
